message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with cross-language learning and natural language processing, which are both sub-fields of computer science. The paper specifically focuses on learning bilingual word representations using autoencoder-based methods. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper proposes different variations of autoencoders, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper uses bag-of-words representations, which could also relate to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as this sub-category often involves analyzing images using bag-of-words models.
